page.title: 14Local footballer
page.content:
John Thomson lived in Cardenden and loved playing football. He was a local hero when he kept goal for Wellesley, junior football club.
In 1926, a scout for Glasgow Celtic came to Fife to watch a goal keeper who was playing for Dunbeath. The scout soon forgot the man he came to see when he spied the acrobatic Thomson in the opposite goal. He immediatly saw John and asked him to play for Glasgow Celtic.
Old Celtic players still recall the arrival of John Thomson in Glasgow. A shy, fresh faced boy of 17, in long blue coat and huge cap. He at once became a favorite with the players, so friendly was his manner so eager was he to learn his craft. John soon made his mark in the Celtic team (cont.)
